course_description: Explores the social, biologic, and public health issues of sexually transmitted diseases and their overall importance in public health. Topics include the basic biology and epidemiology of the major STDs, the implication of transmission models for prevention, and psychosocial, behavioral, and economic aspects of STD/HIV. Cross-listed with EPI 550.
sections: Class Nbr: 3490, Section #: 1, Type: LEC, Campus: ATL, Meets: M 10-11:50a, Instructor: Spaulding/Richard, Status: Open
